text: MFF Football Centre () is a stadium in the independent municipality of Ulaanbaatar within Mongolia. ==Overview== It is currently used for football matches and boasts an artificial playing surface. It has recently played host to Mongolia's attempts to qualify for the AFC Challenge Cup and the 2014 FIFA World Cup. The newly-expanded 5,000 seat stadium at the football centre opened in October 2013. ==References== Category:Football venues in Mongolia Category:Buildings and structures in Ulaanbaatar
title: MFF Football Centre
